job_title: Senior Fundraiser in Cambridge, England
pros:
A fast-moving charity where there's always a new project, partnership or campaign to get to grips with. It kept me interested in my role for many years as things never became dull. 

In recent years the organisation has done a lot of work on staff wellbeing (which was never bad to begin with) and it's a place where colleagues are listened to and valued. The people working here are largely very welcoming, thoughtful and collaborative. This is somewhere you can genuinely feel proud to work.
cons:
In the function I worked in, the workload could be heavy and it was normal to be working extra hours. However, I don't think this was the same across all teams. 

Within the fundraising directorate, it often felt like favouritism was a factor in opportunities and promotions.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cambridge, England
pros:
The wonderful culture and staff.  It really is the most positive and friendly organisation I have ever worked for and is a breath of fresh air. 

There seems to be a real flexible working culture and sense of trust among teams.

I think it's wonderful and fairly unique to have a female CEO - there are no barriers on progression here other than ambition and willingness to learn.
cons:
As the organisation has grown rapidly, some of the processes and structures don't make total sense - this is something they are working on. Full time hours are also slightly longer than in previous roles although quite typical generally - 37.5 hours.

The benefits are reasonably fair for a charity but some are lower than previous employers - e.g. pension contribution and holiday entitlement. 

You don't receive sick pay during your probation period which I've not come accross before. It means that new staff bring in germs to the open plan office!

review_title: Ambitious, supportive and forward thinking charity
job_title: Director of Supporter-led Fundraising in Cambridge, England
pros: As soon as you walk through the door you immediately know this is a great place to work. The warm welcome, the positive energy and friendly employees. The charity are unapologetic about their ambition and relentless drive to bring forth their vision of a life saving testament to slow or stop dementia. Supporters and stakeholders are at the heart of all business decisions to foster excellent collaboration, more meaningful relationships and ensure efficiencies. Employees are given the autonomy to iterate, innovative and strive for excellence. They are also supported through a strong and dedicated leadership team, clear ARUK values and attributes. As well as bespoke training ensuring a leadership mindset is fostered across the charity no matter your position.
cons: It’s a fast paced environment. You need to be prepared to work and play hard.

review_title: Simply the best place I have ever worked...
job_title: Digital Campaign Manager in Cambridge, England
pros: To be part of an organisation whose stated aim is to change the world for the better, is something that cannot be quantified. Everyone in the organsation is kind, enthusiastic, friendly, engaged, passionate and enthusiastic as well as being experts in their field. The company culture is brilliant and I'm excited to be a part of it. The company pays well and other employee benefits are comparable to some of the best local organisations I have worked for.
cons: I suppose the only potential downside is the high staff turnover, but this is caused by the nature of the young demographic of employees who are naturally moving on through their careers rather than any particular issues at the work place. Changing staff isn't a problem per se, but it does mean there is a high need for constantly training and developing new personnel.

job_title: Communications in Cambridge, England

The office uses Yammer and has a social team, ensuring there’s a good vibe in the office and the chance to join groups and make friends.

A polite and friendly office culture.
cons: Not based in the city centre, so it’s a little difficult to nip out for ‘after work drinks’.

job_title: Supporter Engagement Manager in Cambridge, England

I have never worked for such an innovative, forward-thinking organisation like Alzheimer's Research UK.  From the amazing HR team to the enthusiastic fundraising team, the organisation is full of ambitious, creative individuals all working towards the same ultimate goal of beating dementia. 

ARUK makes you feel valued and invest a lot in their employees. I have been to some great training programmes whilst working here enabling me to progress into 2 different roles within the charity. 
A bonus is it's a beautiful location and on the doorstep facilities.

As a growing fast-paced organisation don't expect your own dedicated desk space, more staff are required to hot desk around the office- which can be fun! 

Limited air-con so can be a tad warm in the summer.

review_title: ARUK - a fantastic place to work
job_title: Senior Design Officer in Cambridge, England
pros:
This organisation engenders such a spirit of positivity and 'can do' attitude. Everyone is so motivated and I believe the reason for this is that everyone is encouraged to put forward ideas which are genuinely listened to and acted on. Anything is possible here. Every person is respected and the welcome you receive as a new starter is great. 

This is an organisation in which you can be you. There is an active social organisation, opportunities to take part in fund raising activity and flexibility around start and finish times and working from home. There is so much support around training and the induction is very thorough. Equipment is all ready for you when you start. There is a buddy system for new starters which ensures you feel part of things from the start.

My line manager has been so helpful and patient with helping me to familiarise myself with the systems and equipment. The organisation is very good at keeping staff informed of what is going on via meetings and away days. Every person is given training on understanding dementia and Alzheimer's. There is such a feeling of positivity, knowing that we are all working together to support the scientists and researchers who are working hard every day to make a breakthrough. This gives a massive added level of job satisfaction which I have not experienced in any of the previous employers that I have worked for.

I can definitely say that, as an employee of ARUK, I have found my place in the world and I have maximum job satisfaction. I can't quite believe how great it is to work here, but talking to employees who have been here longer than me, I am not the only one who feels this way. I would highly recommend it to anyone and I have already recommended it to several other people.
cons: Pay is a bit lower than comparable positions for some sectors, but this is massively outweighed by great job satisfaction.
